data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you are facing forward, you always face forward. If you are facing backward, you always face backward. If you are facing forward, you always face left. If you are facing backward, you always face right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You only turn around once, so this sequence only includes turning back. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The number of steps to get to the starting point is 6 and 4 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
For each step, you can go 1 step back to the start step. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 10 steps each first time and turn around. Take 10 steps each second time and turn around. Take 3 steps each second and take 3 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you change directions, you'll turn to the right, turn to the left, turn around, run, and turn around to the right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Right turns means turn right. 8 steps and 9 steps mean the same thing. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around, then you took 8 steps from where you stood to return to your starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Place the hand next to a person’s forehead facing away from you using the palm of your dominant hand. Move your arm about 2/3 of the way to the left and move your left foot about 1/4 of the way to the right. Make sure it is about 4 inches or 5 inches away from your hand. Move your foot in the direction you are facing from the same spot on the surface of the road that you are walking on. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around is the first step back to the original starting point. You can always take 2 steps back to the starting point after you turn around. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
As you always face forward it is impossible to take 2 steps backward. This is true for one step and 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Either the steps 1 and 7 were taken backwards or the steps 2 and 1 were taken backwards. They are opposites. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Face forward, always. A person cannot go into an apartment building and go back to a building where they started, until one reaches and addresses the building to enter. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A man who always faces outward can also take 6 steps left. The answer: Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 8 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person cannot return to the starting point using two different steps at the same time. The answer: no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions say you return to the starting point with 7 steps. The instructions say you return to the starting point with 9 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you return to the starting point, you will turn around, turn around, but only take 9 steps, which is not the same as turning around. If you take 7 steps, you will be back at the starting point, with one last turn to your right side. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To turn right and to take 7 steps at the same time, you will get the same answer as those who turn right and take 5 steps at the same time, which is Yes. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 1 step. Take 1 step. Take 3 steps. Turn left. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You take 3 steps, and you turn left. Thus, you take 6 steps. Thus, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turn around and take 2 steps each. Turn around and take 3 steps each. Twist around and take a single step each. Twist the directions up the number of steps so you have 10 steps total. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 3 steps. Turn around = 2 steps. Take 3 steps + 7 steps = 16 steps. Take 10 steps = 20 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Your left foot should be facing forward and your right foot should always be facing right. You can walk in multiple directions in one person and face forward at all times. It takes 7 steps to backwards while 8 steps take 5 steps backward. Therefore, the answer is Yes.

The first step backward is to face backward. If one takes 9 steps left, that is 9 steps left. So, the answer is No.

Turn around if you are going backwards and take 4 steps. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person cannot return to the starting point by causing others to follow in your footsteps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There is 1 first to turn back and you do not return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward you can proceed in any direction to the other side. If you take 2 steps backward you can proceed in the direction and not the direction. If you take 3 steps backward you can proceed in the direction and not the direction. So, the answer is No.

Assuming a person took 10 steps they would back to the starting point of 1 step. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There are usually 10 steps to walk around. There are not always those big, obvious steps and they usually end in a circle. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps right. Take 7 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 7 steps backward and you are back to the point where you started. In the first sentence, you are facing right. However, In the second sentence, you were facing left. So, you returned to the starting point. Thus, the answer is no.

Turn around is a reversible direction of movement. To return to the starting point, you take the same number of steps as the original direction of movement. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting place, or direction of travel, is always forward. Taking 5 backward steps means to step backwards. So, the answer is no.

To get from left to right you have to always face forward. We know that right turns to left and right is to right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps forward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 7 steps right. Take 8 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Backwards steps are from going forward. Forward steps are from going away. Forward steps are from going forward to going backward. So, the answer is no.

Turning around is the same as returning to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

10 steps is the number of steps it takes you to return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward, you begin a new path. The only way to return to start is from where you left off. Final answer: yes.

Step forward is to be placed in front of everything in front of you. Going backward is to stop taking steps forward. So, the answer is no.

It starts you at the beginning point and the rest of the way goes around it. Turn around and turn right then turn left and the rest of the way goes around it. So, the answer is Yes.

At the beginning, face forward. You don’ t always face forward. If you move left by 6 steps, you return to the starting point by taking the left two steps forward. Just as you don' t move forward by 3 steps, you do not move forward by 3 steps left. So, the answer is No.

If you have taken 9 steps left, you will need to take 9 steps right. If you have took 5 steps left, you will need to take 5 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

To do this: Take 10 steps forward. Take 10 steps backward. Take 8 steps backward. To do this: Take 8 steps forward. Take 10 steps forward. Take 7 steps backward. To do this: Take 7 steps right. Take 7 steps left. Take 1 step right. Thus, the answer is Yes.

After facing forward, you are in a forward direction. Upon returning to your starting point, you are facing backward. So, the answer is no.
